subject: Ethics
title: Carbon Colonialism
description: A quick, practical guide to Carbon Colonialism.

hook.text: A European company plants a massive forest in Ugandaâ€”then bans local farmers from their own land.

buildup.text: Carbon offset programs let wealthy nations 'erase' emissions by funding green projects in poor countries.

discovery.text: Carbon colonialism describes how offset schemes can displace indigenous people and exploit developing nations.

twist.text: The polluter keeps polluting. The community losing its land gets a certificate saying emissions were 'offset.'

climax.text: Critics say it's the same old pattern: rich nations using poor nations' resources to ease their conscience.

punchline.text: New name, old playbook. Colonialism in a green jacket.

quiz.question: What is carbon colonialism?
options: When wealthy nations offset emissions through projects that exploit or displace people in poor countries
When developing nations refuse to reduce their carbon emissions
When colonial-era factories still pollute former colonies
